snippet: The New York City Housing Authority has come under fire for the lack of security cameras at a housing project where a 6-year-old boy was stabbed to death on Sunday.
abstract: New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio, responding to outcry over killing of 6-year-old Prince Joshua Avitto in Brooklyn, blames 'unacceptable bureaucracy' for delays in installing security cameras in many public housing projects, including one where boy was stabbed to death.

byline.original: By MIREYA NAVARRO and NATE SCHWEBER

lead_paragraph: The New York City Housing Authority has come under fire for the lack of security cameras at a housing project where a 6-year-old boy was stabbed to death on Sunday.

headline.main: Lack of Cameras in Public Housing Outrages Residents and de Blasio
headline.print_headline: Lack of Cameras in Public Housing Outrages Residents and de Blasio
